abstract: Editorial contends extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a 'person,' would destroy women’s reproductive rights; argues besides outlawing abortions, with no exceptions for rape, incest or when a woman's life is in danger, measure carries serious implications, including creating a legal quagmire.
snippet: An extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a “person,” would destroy women’s reproductive rights.
lead_paragraph: An extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a “person,” would destroy women’s reproductive rights.
